confession.seduction_date: 10 years before (initially said 2 years, changed under torture)

instructed to knock down cabbage heads to destroy grain
moving vine cuttings with feet to damage vines
master carried her on shoulders with noise like thunder

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: a week after husband fell ill
after it got into her house
that night after being in stable

timeline.subject: Jeanne Bigenel
timeline.details: Following insults from Bastien Treuchot who called her 'vielle genosse, sorciere, coppon d'enfer' and complaint by her husband

timeline.subject: Jeanne Bigenel
timeline.details: Remy asks for arrest and interrogation; Change de Nancy approves

timeline.subject: Jeanne Bigenel
timeline.details: First interrogation - denied charges, provided natural explanations

timeline.subject: Jeanne Bigenel
timeline.details: Remy asks for torture; Change de Nancy asks for separate interrogation on each charge and different confrontation with witnesses

timeline.subject: Jeanne Bigenel
timeline.details: Second interrogation - provided detailed life history, continued to deny charges

timeline.subject: Jeanne Bigenel
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses, particularly Claudin le Gaulx; denied all charges

timeline.subject: Jeanne Bigenel
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves torture with moderation appropriate to her age

timeline.subject: Jeanne Bigenel
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - confessed to seduction by devil named Percinet, receiving powders, causing harms, attending sabbat

timeline.subject: Jeanne Bigenel
timeline.details: Remy asks for death sentence; Change de Nancy approves subject to reiteration of confessions

timeline.subject: Jeanne Bigenel
timeline.details: Confirmed earlier confessions, claimed master never made her renounce God or forbade church attendance

timeline.subject: Jeanne Bigenel
timeline.details: Found dead in prison; goaler said she had eaten well previous day and made no complaint about illness; no apparent reason for death

methods: rack or strappado (method not specified in detail)
torture.restrictions: with moderation appropriate to her age

prior_accusations.context: On deathbed accused Jeanne of causing her death through malefice, claiming this happened when Claudin went off with Jeanne for 6-7 weeks while Babon was ill

notable_quotes.speaker: Bastien Treuchot
notable_quotes.context: Public insult that triggered husband's complaint and initiated the trial

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeon femme Jean Jantaire (witness 8 reporting)
notable_quotes.french: Vienca sorciere, ne veux tu pas dessorceller mon marit, t'avois bien grande haste de te lever de dessus ta selle, pour luy faire asseoir et pour l'engenosser ce n'est pas des auljourdhuy que tu nous hay, et tu as envy a nous, tu es venu tout a temps pour nous faire du mal
notable_quotes.english: Come here witch, won't you un-bewitch my husband, you were in great hurry to get up from your seat to make him sit and to bewitch him, it's not just today that you hate us and envy us, you came just in time to do us harm
notable_quotes.context: Public accusation of bewitching her husband Jean Jantaire

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne Bigenel (to Mengeon)
notable_quotes.french: Se n'est pas des auljourdhuy que tu nous veulx du mal, meschante langue
notable_quotes.english: It's not just today that you wish us harm, wicked tongue
notable_quotes.context: Response to accusation about killing pig

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne Bigenel
notable_quotes.french: Jesus Didier voila le Rousel qui a ung cheval mort il dict que je l'ay faict mourir, je n'en crainct dieu, le monde, Son Altesse ny la justice
notable_quotes.english: Jesus Didier, there's Rousel who has a dead horse, he says I made it die, I don't fear God, the world, His Highness or justice
notable_quotes.context: Distraught statement to Didier Malgendre when accused of killing horse

notable_quotes.speaker: Wife of Jean Michault (witness 20)
notable_quotes.french: Vous avez faict mon marit malade, Monsieur de Roussy n'en est guaire content, s'il scavoit que vous fussiez telle il vous feroit brusler
notable_quotes.english: You made my husband sick, Monsieur de Roussy is not at all pleased, if he knew you were such a one he would have you burned

notable_quotes.speaker: Orianne femme Anthoine Jeantaire (witness 21)
notable_quotes.french: il y fault jecter de la pouldre par la a tous les diables
notable_quotes.english: one must throw powder there to all the devils
notable_quotes.context: Overheard Jeanne saying this while washing a pot in stream

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudin le Gaulx (in interrogation)
notable_quotes.english: old sorcerer king of the brooms
notable_quotes.context: What his wife called him during quarrel, to which he replied 'va sorciere toy mesme' (go witch yourself)

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne Bigenel (under torture)
notable_quotes.french: Jesus pauvre miserable que je suis, je suys abusée
notable_quotes.english: Jesus poor miserable that I am, I am deceived
notable_quotes.context: What she said when she realized devil's money was oak leaves, made sign of cross and hid from him

daughter of Martin Colas and his wife Barbe

Bigenel homme marié et ayant une femme plus belle que ladite Jeanne... la femme dudit Bigenel nommée Babon
her daughter, wife of George Fourot of Nolleray
her daughter Barbe, wife of Fiacre Barbillon

economic_context.details: Jeanne came from poverty (begging with mother after father drowned). Various disputes over property: stolen citrouilles from vines, payment disputes (Claudin le Gaulx refusing to help her in need), employment of daughter, grain payments. Her youth was marked by sexual promiscuity and economic vulnerability. She worked as animal herder and herb collector. Testimony indicates she was viewed as lower class.

harms_catalog.harm_description: body became all swollen after she touched his shoulder
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He demurred when she said Mademoiselle said he should pay her 6 gros within the month

harms_catalog.victim_name: horse (owner not specified but associated with Treuchot)
harms_catalog.harm_description: died as if rabid after she treated it with herbs
milk had been off for 6 weeks, until she asked Jeanne about it, after which it was good again
unable to stand, until a woman had visited him
pains in one leg then the other, without hope of cure
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She falsely accused him of stealing two citrouilles from her vines

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill in same fashion, worse than husband

harms_catalog.harm_description: died after getting into her house
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after it got into her house

harms_catalog.harm_description: ox ill, became violent when Bigenel took it by horns and was thrown to ground, but recovered
fell ill that night after she was in stable, died next day with venom coming from mouth
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: 2 weeks after not renewing daughter's service

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill after she was in stable taking dung out, died next day with venom from mouth, thought bewitched
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Not renewing daughter in service at end of year

harms_catalog.harm_description: became swollen and died 6 weeks later; butcher found worms in lung and creatures like snails from shells in testicles
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Gave her cramoie (vetch) instead of barley when she came to fetch promised grain

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost 4 sheep although no others died in village, even those in same building
harms_catalog.economic_value: witness said would give 10 francs to have her out of world
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Said he would give 10 francs to have her out of world if she were found to be as reputed

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill on way home, remained ill for 6 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She made him sit down where she had been sitting
harms_catalog.method_alleged: making him sit in her seat

Dispute over stolen citrouilles from vines with Drian Gigould

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Found dead in prison with no apparent reason; goaler said she had eaten well previous day and made no complaint about illness

hearsay_chains.content: After quarrel with Jeanne they had both been ill
Their milk had been off for 6 weeks until she asked Jeanne about it, after which it was good again
His child had been ill, unable to stand, until a woman had visited him; told daughter Barbe not to make him speak out

hearsay_chains.source: Daughter of Jeanne (wife of George Fourot)
hearsay_chains.content: Her mother was unwilling to visit sick husband, feared she would cause dishonour
Heard her called witch in public by Treuchot after death of horse 3 years earlier

emotional_state_notes: came into Didier Malgendre's house 'tout esperdu' (completely distraught)
said she didn't fear God, the world, His Highness or justice
husband had to send for Malgendre again to comfort her, found her 'comme prest a mourir' (as if ready to die)
protested her innocence throughout pre-torture interrogations
asked to be put down during torture, saying she would tell truth

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Disagreement over details of relationship with Bigenel - said she was absent only 2 days, not 6 weeks
Claimed Drian Gigoult had been ill since getting very cold when in prison for 2-3 days, not from her witchcraft
Deaths of horses resulted from their being old and badly treated, not witchcraft
Jean Michault's illness resulted from carrying too heavy a load of wood, not from sitting in her seat

third_parties.context: Called her 'vielle genosse, sorciere, coppon d'enfer' in public, triggering husband's complaint and trial; owned horse that died; his wife Lucye also mentioned

third_parties.relationship_to_accused: predecessor as wife of current husband
third_parties.context: Died after being ill for 3+ months; on deathbed accused Jeanne of giving her fatal harm; was 'more beautiful' than Jeanne according to testimony

third_parties.name: Pierre Masson (also called Anthoine Limousin Masson)
third_parties.context: Was betrothed to Jeanne but broke it off; reason given was her stepfather stripped dead animals, not her reputation

third_parties.context: Manouvrier/servant who married Jeanne; they had two children together; lived together 14 years; died 4-5 years into marriage per one account, 14 years per Jeanne's account

third_parties.name: Drolbat
third_parties.context: Charcoal burner who seduced Jeanne when young and accepted responsibility for child

third_parties.name: George Fourot

third_parties.name: Daughter of Jeanne (unnamed, wife of George Fourot)

third_parties.name: 3 masters at sabbat

extraction_metadata.notes: Rich trial record with extensive witness testimony. Complex family and sexual history. Accused came from poverty (begging with widowed mother after father drowned). Multiple marriages and relationships documented. Long reputation (56+ years in village). Confessed under torture to seduction by devil Percinet, attending sabbat, using powders to harm and heal. Died in prison before execution - suspicious death with no apparent cause. Notable features: (1) Trial initiated by defamation complaint by husband, not by community; (2) Mixed testimony - some witnesses spoke well of her; (3) Detailed sabbat description with agricultural symbolism (cabbage heads, vine cuttings); (4) Economic tensions evident (employment disputes, grain payments, property); (5) Gender and class vulnerabilities clear in testimony about her youth; (6) Some apparent contradictions in timeline (6 weeks vs 2 days absence with Bigenel); (7) Death in prison raises questions about conditions/possible suicide/murder. Document quality is good though some incoherence noted in confrontation records.
